ngiemboon: Nambukondonozɔɔ gẅie aa fùɔ Mbambilonia la fó tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm, ńdɔgɔ Yokonia gẅie aa míŋ Jÿohakim wembàŋa, pâ meŋwǎláʼ pà Yúndà, lé metáalɔ̀ɔn, mbɔɔ ngàŋlevfò, ńgʉa né Mbambilonia. À la gʉa púʼu, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo, n gyá metúŋ pÿɛ̀ mémbʉ́a mie nyìŋ ka tÿɔ́gɔ ncwò ndá Ssé.
en: After King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon had deported Jeconiah   son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, the officials of Judah, and the craftsmen and metalsmiths  # 24:1 2Kg 24:14,16; Jr 29:2 from Jerusalem and had brought them to Babylon, the Lord showed me two baskets of figs  # 24:1 Am 8:1 placed in front of the temple of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Á la gʉa na metúŋ ŋwɛ́ mémbʉ́a mie mentɔ̌ɔn pÿɛ̀ laa tsoló, atsɔ̌ tàʼ gẅiin mentɔ̌ɔn pÿɛ̀ mie é sí tɛʼ, páʼ mé káb ntwó mentɔ̌ɔn pÿɛ̀ é gwɔ́, wetsɔ̌ túŋ gẅiin mentɔ̌ɔn pÿɛ̀ mie é cʉŋté; ḿbú ḿbÿág tà ngwɔ́ nyìŋ á le jÿó.
en: One basket contained very good figs, like early figs,   but the other basket contained very bad figs, so bad they were inedible.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɛ́te wɔ́ɔn ngie: «Yelemî, ɔ̀ ne ńgyá kɔ́?» N tsɔ́ʼ ngie: N ne ńgyá mentɔ̌ɔn pÿɛ̀. Emie é ne síi ée mbòŋ tɛʼ, emie é cʉŋté, é ne ḿbÿága tà ngwɔ́ nyìŋ á le jÿó.
en: The Lord said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah? ”
The word of the Lord came to me:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé pa Ésàlayɛ, n gɔ̌ɔn ngie: Mé ne ńdíe mentɔ̌ɔn pÿɛ̀ mie é ne síi, é shʉ́me, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ n ne ńdɔgɔ pòŋontʉ́m, ńdíe pà Yúndà pie é la fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ ńgʉa. Á wɔ́b gẅie n da fó tsɛ̀ɛ wɔɔn ngwòŋ, ńjwoŋo wɔ́b tà ńkúu Mbambilonia.
en: “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: Like these good figs, so I regard as good the exiles from Judah I sent away from this place to the land of the Chaldeans.

ngiemboon: Oon, n ge lɔgɔ pòŋontʉ́m líe wɔ́b, é piŋ piŋe wɔ́b, é náa tsɛ̀ɛ wɔɔn ngwòŋ. N te gíŋe ńne ńkwoŋo létága wɔ́b páʼ mé tága ndá la wɔ́, n ge gíŋe kwɛ́ɛ láʼ. N ge gíŋe pyé wɔ́b, n te ne ńkwoŋo létsɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́b páʼ mé tsɔ́ʼɔ legǐ wɔ́.
en: I will keep my eyes on them for their good   and will return them to this land. I will build them up and not demolish them; I will plant them and not uproot them.  # 24:6 Jr 1:10

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo gÿo tà pɔ́ kuʼu lézsé ngie mèŋ n gee Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Pɔ́ ge gÿo piŋe mbwó mèŋ lé ntʉ́m wɔ́b ntsèm; é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn; mèŋ, n gwɔ́ Ssé yɔb.
en: I will give them a heart to know me,   that I am the Lord. They will be my people, and I will be their God because they will return to me with all their heart.  # 24:7 2Ch 6:38; Jr 29:13

ngiemboon: Táʼ, mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a n gɔɔn nò ńtí Sendesíasè, fùɔ pà Yúndà, pâ meŋwǎláʼ pé, mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é la zso tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm, ńgÿo pʉ̀a pie é tsẅé ngwòŋ Egíbtò fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ngie: «N ge gÿo tɔ́ɔn nò na pɔ́b tà pɔ́ cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ mentɔ̌ɔn pÿɛ̀ mie é cʉŋté, ḿbú ḿbÿág tà ngwɔ́ nyìŋ á le jÿó.
en: “But as for the bad figs, so bad they are inedible,   this is what the Lord says: In this way I will deal with King Zedekiah of Judah, his officials, and the remnant of Jerusalem #— #those remaining in this land or living in the land of Egypt.  # 24:8 Jr 44:1

ngiemboon: À cʉa púʼu, pɔ́ lɔg ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ á mbwó mengwòŋ mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ. Epʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ ŋwɛ́, e gyá wɔ́b, ńcÿɔʼ. Mé piŋ ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ ntsèm mie n da jwoŋo wɔ́b, ńnáa wó, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ḿbíi fʉ̀ʼ, á fʉ̀ʼ gie mé gee ngẅě nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ, kà fʉ̀ʼ gie mé gee nzoonté nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ, kà pɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ gie mé gee ńnéŋ ndòon twó nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ.
en: I will make them an object of horror   and a disaster to all the kingdoms of the earth, an example for disgrace, scorn, ridicule,  # 24:9 Dt 28:37; 1Kg 9:7; 2Ch 7:20 and cursing, wherever I have banished them.  # 24:9 Jr 24:9; 42:18; 44:8,12; 49:13

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo túm ncù, mbɔɔ gwáŋa lâ gwáʼa, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b. E tsẅé ńjÿó wɔ́b tà pɔ́ láʼ maga tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie n da ná né pamángʉanjʉʼ pɔ́b mbɔɔ mbwó pɔ́b.»
en: I will send the sword, famine, and plague   against them until they have perished from the land I gave to them and their ancestors.”
